description: From French and Middle French absterger or from Medieval Latin abstergēre, present active infinitive of abstergeō (“wipe off or away”); formed from Latin abs- + tergeō (“to wipe off”).

verbs.description: absterge (third-person singular simple present absterges, present participle absterging, simple past and past participle absterged)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic, now rare) To make clean by wiping; to wipe away. [First attested in the early 16th century.]
